issue.message: Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `String.format(Locale, ...)` instead

Fixed screen orientations will be ignored in most cases, starting from Android 16. Android is moving toward a model where apps are expected to adapt to various orientations, display sizes, and aspect ratios.

The image `ic_launcher.png` varies significantly in its density-independent (dip) size across the various density versions: drawable-hdpi/ic_launcher.png: 64x64 dp (96x96 px), drawable-mdpi/ic_launcher.png: 72x72 dp (72x72 px), drawable-xhdpi/ic_launcher.png: 48x48 dp (96x96 px), drawable-xxhdpi/ic_launcher.png: 48x48 dp (144x144 px)

Assigning `Locale.getDefault()` to a final static field is suspicious; this code will not work correctly if the user changes locale while the app is running
